alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Comanche; Kiowa; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:01PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Washita, northwestern Comanche, southwestern Caddo and eastern Kiowa Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 301 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Gotebo, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carnegie, Mountain View, Cooperton, Boone, Stecker and northwestern Wichita Mountains Wildlife Refuge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
